subject: My world is realer than your world
msgSnippet: ... I love you, Cedric, like a brother /and/ I think this rant is the single sloppiest thing you ve ever written. I don t have the energy to list all the
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> Sounds like a typical "real-world" software project to me, don't feel bad if
> the Agile practices don't seem very relevant or even practical to you.
> I ranted
> about this very topic <http://beust.com/weblog/archives/000392.html
> <http://beust.com/weblog/archives/000392.html>> a few
> days ago.

I love you, Cedric, like a brother /and/ I think this rant is the single
sloppiest thing you've ever written. I don't have the energy to list all
the problems with it, but I will point out that someone on this list
wrote about 300 pages on bringing Java legacy code under test, including
dozens of examples that cover the core of a J2EE application. What more
do you need? If you don't get the idea by now, then I don't know how to
help you any further.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
